title: This is basically what PBE is right now.
body:
"Guys, lets do a 5 skin battlecast team!"
"Guys, I'm just here to see what this Rengar skin is like."
"I just wanna try out Lulu support because I don't have her on my main account."
"Wanted to see what would happen if I went AP Ashe, only doing it here so I don't lose on my real account."
"Creator Viktor is so cool omfg, I want it on my real account."
"Bard(Me), just go jungle. I really wanna see this Thresh skin."

basically all I see are kids playing PBE because there's free stuff on there and they wanna try old shit out. I feel like the only Bard player on there, as I have with the latest new champions and skins. Literally NOBODY on there actually plays there to test shit out, they play just to see what skins and champions are like because they're too poor or lazy to get them on their actual account.

My last game as Bard, I got forced into the jungle because this guy wanted to Support Thresh and try out the Deepsea Thresh or whatever the fuck that skin is. I was then flamed the rest of the game because I couldn't gank because I was a Bard jungle. I'm not gonna lie, once I went back twice before level 4, it wasn't too bad. But the fact that these kids are playing the game to not even test new content and are sitting here flaming me for doing Bard jungle when I pretty much had to to make the game seem normalish... the fuck man lol.

Riot, there needs to be something done about this. There's too many kids on the PBE who just go on there to try the skins and champions they can't play or don't have and ignore the new content. I can't stress it enough, THERE'S NOBODY ACTUALLY TESTING STUFF ON THERE. 

Is there anyone else that actually tests stuff on there?

First game I played on PBE with Bard I went top. I got first blood. I then proceeded to carry with my AD build into the mid game... and then I was just walking utility that did more than tickle. However, I found that bards attack animation severely limits him from being a viable ranged ADC. 

Anywho, if you truly want to test things out (especially for the first time) then go into custom and actually observe how things work/interact. Make a friend on PBE and test in the same custom game so it's not so tedious :)

I like the idea of it, but the problem is here:
The PBE is a different client and server (like a hidden EUW or NA) with a different update setup than the live client, meaning you would be running Patch 5.6 but the live servers are still on Patch 5.5 if it went on Live, for example.
There's an incompatibility issue with it all so I don't know if this will be possible or not, but I can safely say it probably won't be.

The thing is that is what you want to do PBE is to test and your reward is that your feedback is heard and will be used to make this game better. Even if you add IP per game, that won't change the fact that people are going to just go on PBE to just get their favorite champ and skin for a few games.

That's right, I'm looking at you, Draft Mode mains.


But aside from that, maybe a way to make PBE seem more pure and less-filled with kids who want to try out skins or weird things is keep the people who actually report bugs. For example, if you have played 100 PBE games and have not reported a single bug to Riot, kick 'em from PBE. If they've played 100 PBE games and have reported multiple bugs (say, they report 1 bug every 25 games or so), keep 'em because they actually say things rather than take advantage of the privilege and piss around for 35 minutes.
And then people like me (computer science student with a course in game development), who'd actually know what they'd be doing aren't even allowed on the PBE...
Sounds like maybe ~~already-released~~ unchanged (TU/VU should be tested IMO) skins should just be disallowed on the PBE? Would solve half the issues you bring up anyway.

As someone who has worked on (and still occasionally tests) games, you don't *always* try to break something when you are playing it in a development environment.  Most bugs, issues, errors, etc. will come from playing the game itself.  You never know when that one combination of things you do  -- say...I don't know, a Jinx and a Caitlyn place a trap in the **exact** same spot and an enemy steps on both at the same time -- will happen as a result of *organic play* or *legitimate testing*.

The PBE seems as if it is intended to be a "proving ground" of sorts for Riot of mutual benefit: players get to see and try new, cool stuff at little or no cost, and Riot gets a ton of feedback.

It really is a win-win, despite any other impression out there.  But hey, if you're actively trying to break the PBE, there is nothing wrong with that!
